name: Sergeant McCredie
descriptions: Sergeant McCredie is the non-commissioned officer responsible for Army troops stationed at Camp Golf in 2281. He can be found at the command center in Fallout: New Vegas.
McCredie is a career soldier, who joined the NCR Army at 16.
By 2281, he has been stationed at Camp Golf for some time, drilling troops to keep discipline up and combat readiness high.
McCredie can be found inside the large tent between the two rows of tents behind the southwest of the House Resort on Camp Golf.

topics.topic_text: Captain Gilles at Bitter Springs needs reinforcements. Can you spare any?
topics.response_text: {Angry drill sergeant}Who the hell are you, coming in here and asking me if I can "spare any?" I don't hand out NCR troopers to anybody who wanders out of the Wasteland!
Hell of a thing about Chief Hanlon. I never would have guessed he was capable of it.

topics.topic_text: How do you like serving in the Army?
topics.response_text: Man, it's my life. I joined up when I was 16 - I don't know how to do anything else.

topics.topic_text: How'd you end up at Camp Golf?
topics.response_text: I've been here since the first push into Vegas. Back in the day, this camp was the hotspot for conflicts with the Legion, raider tribes, you name it.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like you're a little disappointed in your troops.
topics.response_text: Disappointed? We call 'em the Misfits for a reason. They're undisciplined, lazy, and they have absolutely no espirit de corps.

topics.topic_text: You joined at 16 and you're still a sergeant?
topics.response_text: Yeah, well... I didn't want to get promoted out of the field. I didn't join up to drive a desk.
Thanks. I only wish some of the soldiers under my command would share some of it.

topics.topic_text: Funny, I thought this was where they sent washouts and losers.
topics.response_text: Yeah, well, somebody has to wrangle those washouts and losers. Somebody's got to turn them into a real fighting force.

topics.topic_text: So what do you do now that the fighting's died down?
topics.response_text: Mostly drill the troops, try to keep the discipline up and combat readiness high.

topics.topic_text: Maybe I can help you whip them into shape.
topics.response_text: You're welcome to try - hell, maybe they'll listen to somebody they don't see as an authority figure.

topics.topic_text: Tough luck. If the Legion attacks, they're dead meat.
topics.response_text: I'd be skeptical of the odds, myself. I just hope they figure it out before it comes to that.

topics.topic_text: If they don't, it's their loss.
topics.response_text: I suppose so. Sorry, this isn't your problem, I shouldn't be going on to you about this.
